column5: can any one reccomend an online fishing store with a large selection of fishing gear not cabellas, or bass pro looking to try and keep my money in canada.  im looking for a good selection of deep water walleye gear i.e. dipsy divers bottom bouncers that kinda stuff. lebaron website sucks. sail doesnt have what im looking for. cdn tire sucks . lol thought some one might have a site i could use as i am having a brain fart in this category  . currently in mexico working  and get home in a week and am trying to do a little pre shopping before i get home and hit  erie for some walleye  cheers rocky
Two Canadian site to consider would be www.fishheadscanada.net and www.centerpinangling.com , but I haven't used them for walleye gear.

This might help you a bit.  Not sure if there are stores listed, but manufacturers are and they often have online stores and lists of resellers.  http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=46973&hl=%2Bmade+%2Bcanada  Here is the list of resellers from XZone Lures site:  http://w.xzonelures.com/?page_id=66  Plenty of websites listed there.  There's always LeBaron and Sail as well.
Centerpin angling is my go to site for specialty steelhead gear, but for other purchases I just order from the states. Even after duty, shipping, and taxes, you can still save a ton.

cabelas.ca might work  cabelas now has a canadian site and they are opening a store in barrie next year according to the website.  I still order off of cabelas.com and they send stuff usually in about 4 days but I do have to pay for the shipping which is a pain (eg. 14 $ for 5 rattlin rapalas etc)  but they are quick
Irishfield is correct etackle is my go to place for fishn stuff.
etackle should answer their emails if they are serious about getting business.
Don't recall seeing Phil around here in quite awhile.
He's around, just a tad busy with work relocation and family obligations.
